data.title: International Criminal Court seeks Israeli PM’s arrest
data.description: THE HAGUE - The International Criminal Court issued arrest warrants on Thursday for Israeli Prime Minister  Benjamin Netanyahu  and his former defence chief, as well as a Hamas leader, Ibrahim Al-Masri, for alleged  war crimes  and crimes against humanity in the Gaza conflict.

data.title: Iceland volcano erupts for 10th time in three years
data.description: OSLO — A volcano near Iceland

data.title: Cambodian canal megaproject in trouble
data.description: PHNOM PENH - At a ceremony in August, Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Manet knelt to receive blessings from monks as fireworks and balloons heralded the breaking of ground for a  canal  he hopes will transform his country’s economic fortunes.

data.title: Vietnam, Malaysia seek to smooth tensions in South China Sea
data.description: Vietnam and Malaysia agreed to elevate ties and explore closer cooperation to maintain peace in the South China Sea, after a complaint from Malaysia raised tensions over the contested waters.

data.title: Study shows simple questions can help detect Alzheimer's
data.description: KYOTO — A method developed by a Japanese team using three questions allows easy screening of Alzheimer

data.title: Putin ‘open to Ukraine truce talks with Trump’
data.description: MOSCOW — Russian President Vladimir Putin is open to discussing a Ukraine ceasefire deal with Donald Trump but rules out making any major territorial concessions and insists Kyiv abandon ambitions to join NATO, five sources with knowledge of Kremlin thinking told Reuters.

data.title: Japan sets monthly visitor record
data.description: TOKYO - Japan welcomed a record 3.31 million foreign visitors last month, official data showed on Wednesday, as the weak yen propelled a tourism boom that is pouring money into the country’s coffers.

data.title: US will provide land mines to Ukraine after approval on missiles
data.description: WASHINGTON — The United States will provide Ukraine with antipersonnel land mines to blunt the advance of Russian troops, an official familiar with the decision said, the latest effort by the Joe Biden administration to bolster support for Kyiv ahead of President-elect Donald Trump

data.title: Hong Kong pro-democracy tycoon testifies in national security trial
data.description: HONG KONG — Hong Kong pro-democracy tycoon Jimmy Lai on Wednesday testified in court for the first time in his years-long national security legal battle on charges of conspiracy to collude with foreign forces, and publishing seditious materials.

data.title: Philippines to repatriate Filipina drug convict from Indonesia
data.description: MANILA/JAKARTA — A Filipina spared from execution on drug trafficking charges in Indonesia in 2015 will be returned to the Philippines after years of negotiations between the two Southeast Asian neighbours, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr said on Wednesday.

data.title: SpaceX Starship launch ends with dramatic water landing
data.description: BROWNSVILLE — The late-afternoon launch brought United States President-elect Donald Trump to the company

data.title: Putin issues new nuclear warning after Ukrainian strike
data.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday lowered the threshold for a nuclear strike in response to a broader range of conventional attacks, as Ukraine used US long-range missiles to strike Russian territory for the first time.

data.title: British farmers rally against inheritance tax
data.description: LONDON - Thousands of farmers protested at Britain’s parliament and some drove tractors through central London on Tuesday to demand the scrapping of an inheritance tax that they say will destroy family farms and threaten food production.

data.title: Sabotage feared as Baltic Sea cables cut
data.description: Two undersea fibre-optic communications cables in the Baltic Sea, including one linking Finland and Germany, have been severed, raising suspicions of sabotage, the countries and companies involved say.

data.title: Maori rights rally draws thousands in New Zealand
data.description: WELLINGTON - Tens of thousands of New Zealanders rallied in front of parliament on Tuesday in one of the country’s largest ever protests to oppose a bill, which opponents say seeks to dilute the rights of Maori and threatens to set race relations back decades.

data.title: Hong Kong jails 45 democracy activists in landmark national security trial
data.description: HONG KONG - Hong Kong

data.title: Hundreds queue for sentencing of 47 Hong Kong democrats
data.description: HONG KONG: Hundreds queued on Tuesday outside a Hong Kong court ahead of the sentencing of 45 pro-democracy activists in a landmark national security trial that has damaged the city

data.title: What Russia's invasion has cost Ukraine as war reaches 1000th day
data.description: KYIV - Russia

data.title: At least 8 killed as super typhoon struck Philippines
data.description: MANILA - At least eight people were killed as super typhoon Man-Yi hit the Philippine archipelago over the weekend, unleashing fierce winds and strong rains that triggered landslides and storm surges, authorities said.

data.title: Singapore oil tycoon OK Lim sentenced to 17 years in jail
data.description: Singapore oil tycoon Lim Oon Kuin has been sentenced to 17 and a half years in jail for cheating HSBC Holdings Plc and instigating forgery in a case that has shaken the city-state’s commodity-trading community and left banks nursing hefty losses.

data.title: Biden lifts ban on Ukraine using US arms to strike inside Russia
data.description: WASHINGTON - Outgoing-President Joe Biden

data.title: Russia says it downs 59 Ukrainian drones, including two heading towards Moscow
data.description: Russia

data.title: Philippines, United States to sign military intelligence-sharing deal
data.description: MANILA: The Philippines and the United States will sign on Monday a military intelligence-sharing deal, Manila

data.title: Russia fires 120-missile barrage at Ukrainian energy sites
data.description: Russia launched one of its largest missile and drone strikes against energy infrastructure and other targets across Ukraine on Sunday as its invasion nears the 1,000-day mark.

data.title: India's successful test of hypersonic missile puts it among elite group
data.description: NEW DELHI - India has successfully tested a domestically developed long-range hypersonic missile, it said on Sunday, attaining a key milestone in military development that puts it in a small group of nations possessing the advanced technology.

data.title: Japanese troops to train with Australia, US militaries in Darwin
data.description: SYDNEY - Japanese troops will begin regular deployments in northern Australia as part of military cooperation with Australia and the US, Australia

data.title: Taiwan, democracy, development are China's 'red lines', Xi tells Biden
data.description: BEIJING - China

data.title: Super typhoon Man-Yi set to weaken as it barrels through Philippines
data.description: MANILA - Super typhoon Man-Yi swept across the Philippines

data.title: Biden, Xi agreed that humans, not AI, should control nuclear weapons, White House says
data.description: LIMA: US President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping agreed on Saturday that human beings and not  artificial intelligence  should make decisions over the use of  nuclear weapons , according to the White House.

data.title: Philippines urges thousands to flee super typhoon
data.description: MANILA - Philippine authorities issued an urgent appeal on Saturday for residents in low-lying areas and coastal towns to move to safety as super typhoon Man-Yi gained strength on its approach towards the country’s main Luzon island.

data.title: Chinese probe finds oldest evidence of lunar volcanoes
data.description: China’s Chang’e-6 robotic spacecraft in June made history by retrieving the first surface samples from the far side of the moon, which perpetually faces away from Earth. That material is now providing new insight into the moon’s geological history, including the oldest evidence to date of lunar volcanism.

data.title: Iran ‘told US it’s not trying to kill Trump’
data.description: Iran sent a message to the Biden administration in October saying that it was not trying to kill Donald Trump, as Tehran attempted to ease rising tensions with Washington, according to US officials, as well as an Iranian official and an analyst.
